title: Part D
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not include support for the claim by stating that if calcineurin is inhibited, then the steps in this pathway that follow from calcineurin activation will be unable to block cell division/induce apoptosis. Since cancer is characterized by excessive cell division, this drug would be an inappropriate treatment for cancer.

The response includes support for the claim by stating that if calcineurin is inhibited, then the steps in this pathway that follow from calcineurin activation will be unable to block cell division/induce apoptosis. Since cancer is characterized by excessive cell division, this drug would be an inappropriate treatment for cancer.
